column2: A calculation used to analyze data points by creating a series of averages of different subsets of the full data set.
A type of moving average that places a greater weight and significance on the most recent data points.
A basic arithmetic moving average calculated by adding recent closing prices and then dividing that by the number of time periods.
A volatility indicator that consists of a set of three lines drawn in relation to security prices.
A momentum oscillator that measures the speed and change of price movements.
A trend-following momentum indicator that shows the relationship between two moving averages of a securityâ€™s price.
A method of technical analysis for determining support and resistance levels.
A momentum indicator comparing a particular closing price of a security to a range of its prices over a certain period of time.
A collection of technical indicators that show support and resistance levels, as well as momentum and trend direction.
A measure of volatility introduced by market technician J. Welles Wilder Jr.
A method devised by J. Welles Wilder Jr. to find potential reversals in the market price direction.
A method of reading candlestick charts that is used to predict the future direction of price movement.
A trading benchmark used by traders that gives the average price a security has traded at throughout the day, based on both volume and price.
A technical trading momentum indicator that uses volume flow to predict changes in stock price.
A momentum oscillator, which measures the percentage change between the most recent price and the price in a previous period.
An oscillator used to help determine when an investment vehicle is reaching a condition of being overbought or oversold.
A cumulative indicator that uses volume and price to assess whether a stock is being accumulated or distributed.
A momentum indicator that measures the flow of money into and out of a security.
An oscillator that measures the volume-weighted average of accumulation and distribution over a specified period.
A volatility-based envelope set above and below an exponential moving average.
A moving average indicator that plots the highest high and the lowest low over a set period of time.
A technical indicator used to identify trends in an underlying security and the likelihood that the trends will reverse.
A form of technical analysis that looks for recurrent long-term price patterns related to persistent changes in investor sentiment and psychology.
A technical analysis indicator used to determine the overall trend of the market over different time frames.
A momentum indicator that measures overbought and oversold levels.
A method of predicting price movements through the relation of geometric angles in charts.
A type of candlestick chart that filters out market noise.
A technical indicator that identifies the start of a new trend or the continuation of an existing trend.
A moving average that aims to reduce the lag of traditional moving averages while maintaining a smooth curve.
An indicator that calculates the momentum of a security.
A technical analysis oscillator used to measure momentum across multiple timeframes.
A market breadth indicator that is based on the difference between the number of advancing and declining issues on an exchange.
A volume-based indicator that is designed to predict long-term trends of money flow while remaining sensitive enough to detect short-term fluctuations.
A momentum oscillator that displays the percent rate of change of a triple exponentially smoothed moving average of the security's closing price.
The difference between the 3-day and 10-day exponential moving averages of the Accumulation/Distribution Line.
An indicator used to identify potential reversals based on the range between high and low prices.
A pair of lines that represent the highest high and the lowest low for a given period, often used to indicate trends.
A trend-following indicator that is used to identify price trends and filter out market noise.
Measures the strength of buying and selling pressure.
A measure of the amount of variation or dispersion of a set of values.
A measure of how choppy or smooth a market is.
A tool used to measure the strength of bulls and bears in the market.
An indicator used to eliminate long-term trends in prices.
Measures the difference between two moving averages of volume.
A momentum oscillator applying the stochastic oscillator formula to the relative strength index values.
Measures the strength of bulls and bears in the market.
Measures the conviction of a recent price action and the likelihood that it will continue.
A volume-based indicator that is used to identify the flow of funds into and out of a security.
Identifies the start of a new trend or the continuation of an existing trend.
A technical indicator that uses both price and volume to measure the amount of money flowing in and out of a security.
A type of technical analysis indicator created to identify trends in the market and provide buy and sell signals.
A technical analysis method that defines support and resistance, identifies trend direction, gauges momentum, and provides trading signals.
